partial_orders.reason: Both edits perform an identical textual substitution pattern: changing error messages from generic function names ('convolve()' and 'correlate()') to their specific 2D variants ('convolve2d()' and 'correlate2d()'). This is a uniform bulk edit applying the same before→after pattern to the same type of syntactic construct (error message strings) across multiple functions. Both edits are part of a single, contiguous refactoring task to correct function names in error messages, and either edit can be made independently without creating any code dependency on the other.

Both edits perform an identical textual substitution pattern: changing error messages from generic function names ('convolve()' and 'correlate()') to their specific 2D variants ('convolve2d()' and 'correlate2d()'). This is a uniform bulk edit applying the same before→after pattern to the same type of syntactic construct (error message strings) across multiple functions. Both edits are part of a single, contiguous refactoring task to correct function names in error messages, and either edit can be made independently without creating any code dependency on the other.

Edit 0 removes the NotImplementedError for mode='same' in the correlate2d function, effectively enabling support for 'same' mode. Edit 1 adds 'same' to the list of modes being tested in the test suite for correlate2d. These edits reference the exact same functionality (correlate2d with mode='same') and form a natural implementation-test pair where removing the restriction in the implementation enables the corresponding test coverage. Either edit could be made first - the implementation change enables the functionality while the test change adds coverage for it.
